availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Lazarus Lawson Mainous (Owlsey County, Kentucky, farmer, corporal (U.S.A.))

body.p: Booneville, Kentucky, farmer and soldier. Virginia native. Married to Rebecca Flannery Mainous. Father of Cynthia Mainous, Absalom Mainous, Martha J. Mainous, Amanda Mainous, Matilda Mainous, Walter Preston Mainous, John T. Mainous, Mary G. Mainous, Josiah Mainous, Daniel C. Mainous, Elbert L. Mainous, and Hampton Mainous. Farmer in Lee County, Virginia in 1850. Farmer in Owsley County, Kentucky in 1860. Served as corporal in the Fourteenth Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry from August 1862 to March 1864.

ab.bibl:
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 1, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 380.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Virginia, Lee, District 31, p. 340B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Owsley, p. 332.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Owsley, Travellers Rest, p. 344A.
Find A Grave, "Lazarus Lawson Mainous (1808-1895)," Memorial #9029236, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/9029236 (accessed May 24, 2019).
